memberdef.argsstring: (CFE_SB_MsgPtr_t CmdPacket, uint16 ExpectedLength, uint32 EventID, char *CmdText)
memberdef.name: FM_IsValidCmdPktLength

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This function is invoked from each of the command handlers to verify the length of the command packet.

parameterdescription.para: - Pointer to a CFE Software Bus command packet

entry.para: Boolean TRUE indicates a valid packet length

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This function is invoked from the copy and move file command handlers to verify the target file overwrite argument. Acceptable values are TRUE (one) and FALSE (zero).

entry.para: Boolean TRUE indicates a valid overwrite argument

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This function creates a list of open files and returns the number of open files.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This function performs a series of tests on the input filename to determine first whether the name contains valid characters for use as a filename, and then whether the filename is currently in use by the file system as a file or directory. If the caller is the Get File Info command handler, the function also stores the file size and last modified timestamp.

parameterdescription.para: - Boolean: Is this for the Get File Info command?

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This function calls the Get Filename State function and generates an error event if the state is invalid.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This function calls the Get Filename State function and generates an error event if the state is anything other than a closed file.

entry.para: Boolean TRUE indicates that filename is an open file

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This function calls the Get Filename State function and generates an error event if the state is anything other than an open file or a closed file.

entry.para: Boolean TRUE indicates filename is an existing file

briefdescription.para: Verify File Does Not Exist Function.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This function calls the Get Filename State function and generates an error event if the state is anything other than the name is unused - the name is not a file and is not a directory.

entry.para: Boolean TRUE indicates the name is unused

briefdescription.para: Verify File Is Not Open Function.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This function calls the Get Filename State function and generates an error event if the state is a directory or an open file.

entry.para: Boolean TRUE indicates the name is unused or a closed file

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This function calls the Get Filename State function and generates an error event if the state is not an existing directory.

parameterdescription.para: - Pointer to buffer containing directory name
- Size of directory name character buffer

entry.para: Boolean TRUE indicates the directory exists

briefdescription.para: Verify Directory Does Not Exist Function.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This function calls the Get Filename State function and generates an error event if the state is an existing file or directory.

parameterdescription.para: - Pointer to buffer containing directory name
- Size of directory name character buffer

entry.para: Boolean TRUE indicates the name is unused

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This function verifies that the child task interface queue is not full and that the queue index values are within bounds.

entry.para: Boolean TRUE indicates the child task queue is available

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This function is called after the caller has loaded the next available entry in the child task queue with the arguments for the current command. The function updates the queue access index and then verifies that the Child Task is operational. If the Child Task is operational then it is signaled via handshake semaphore to process the next command from the queue. If instead, the Child Task is not operational, the Child Task queue processor function is called directly to process the current command. The difference between the two methods is in which execution thread is active when the command is processed.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This function appends a path separator character (slash) to a directory name in advance of combining the directory name with directory entry names to create qualified filenames. The function will only append the separator character if there is room in the buffer for another character.

parameterdescription.para: - Pointer to buffer containing directory name
- Size of directory name character buffer
